Our homes are in a gated community where no one without a pass can enter so we are safe and we have security 24/7
there are a number of clubs i met during my campus visit like the GSA or gay straight alliance, peace core and many others there is a diverse number of clubs and they are all very nice
great for nature loving people and for layed back people
the moonings are interesting i cant wait for my first one. oh and we have a snow day where the staff brings piles of snow to our housing doors

we have a shuttle that takes us to the beach and to the movie theaters so transportation isnt an issue we also get 5 dollar disneyland tickets and also of discounts to aquariums and theme parks. we also have moonings where bands play at night during full moons in the court yard for the students
the food is really yummy the cost is reasonable there are delicious meals for 5-7 dollars. we get free inn n out burgers on certain days and free starbucks as well. i love the food there.
from what i've seen the doorm life is very comfortable and energetic everyone knows everybody and it is a very homelike setting
classes are able to challage the students here and it makes it an interesting expereience. also the teachers are so well prepared and always there to help.

choose a school that has small class sizes if you want more one on one help with your learning expereience. choose a school in good geographic location with favorable weather. choose a school that matches your career choice

What amazed me most about my new college is the welcoming atmosphere. The staff and students were so nice and full of energy and the unity between everyone on campus is great. The size of the campus is small so that there is a small student to professor ratio I believe this will allow me to achieve more knowledge then in an average community college.
pageTitle: Marymount California University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {10243=Marymount is a very small campus, and puts all of the students first. The student to teacher ratio is 9:1, so the professors really get to know you on a first name basis. It is a private school, so it is more expensive than others, but classes are pretty much guaranteed, and it is worth it in the long run because of the one-on-one experience and the ability to graduate on time., 74611=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 58907=We were able to have the opportunity to have a anchor transferred from out of the pacific ocean into our school weighing 10,000 pounds. It was a gift to our 2012 class Seniors from our 2014 Sophomore class. The anchor is a symbol for school spirit.}

textAfterTable: In three sentences Marymount College is ideal for those who don't want to get lost in the University/Larger Colleges. I have found that the smaller classrooms allow me to feel more comfortable in seeking further help from my teachers. Their study hall, as been a wonderful place for me to do my homework and research paper's I need to write. Being a new student, I am often not sure of many things, I have made many trips to the Administration Office and everybody I have come in contact with has been kind and helpful. This school really does make you feel like you matter and that you are important. I am enjoying everyday at my new school, I like my roommates and team mates. This school has everything I was seeking for college! Login to rate or flag the reviews Alexandra from Torrance, CA 06/25/2012 Reviewer is Accepted here and planning to attend soon. Reviewer has been to campus. 2 out of 2 people found this review useful. 2 of 16 Categories Comments Campus Safety
